div.p: Greetings. Assist the bearer of this letter with your advice, if it can be done anywhere, in the name of God and myself, my dearest brother. I am otherwise moderately well with my whole family. Daily and eagerly I expect the remainder that is left on the Apocalypse. Send it, my Bullinger, and refresh your old Gervasius. I am so overwhelmed with almost infinite tasks that I cannot write more due to the messenger's hasty departure. At least embrace this one, whom I commend to your charity, as my own flesh. Farewell, incomparable friend. Greet your family for me.
Given on the 1st of May in the year 1556.
To the most illustrious man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, chief minister of the church of ZÃ¼rich, lord brother, and dearest old friend.
